performance-implicit-conversion-in-loop.description:
Description

This warning appears in a range-based loop with a loop variable of const ref
type where the type of the variable does not match the one returned by the
iterator. This means that an implicit conversion happens, which can for example
result in expensive deep copies.

Example:

map
<
int
,
vector
<
string
>>
my_map
;
for
(
const
pair
<
int
,
vector
<
string
>>&
p
:
my_map
)
{}
// The iterator type is in fact pair<const int, vector<string>>, which means
// that the compiler added a conversion, resulting in a copy of the vectors.

The easiest solution is usually to use
const
auto&
instead of writing the
type manually.
performance-implicit-conversion-in-loop.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
